intro: Euphrasia rostkoviana subsp. kreiselii, commonly known as the Balkan eyebright, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and the Middle East. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland edges or grassy areas. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs. Euphrasia rostkoviana subsp. kreiselii is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
